messages.content: What does the SDXL Prompt Styler node do?

The SDXL Prompt Styler node enables users to style prompts based on predefined templates stored in multiple JSON files. It replaces a `{prompt}` placeholder with provided positive text and manages negative prompts by combining negative text with the `negative_prompt` field from the template.
What was added in the SDXL Prompt Styler Advanced node in the January 26, 2024 commit?
In the January 26, 2024 commit, a new option was added to the SDXL Prompt Styler Advanced node. This option allows copying positive G prompt tokens to L while removing duplicates.
What new feature was added in the January 19, 2024 commit?
On January 19, 2024, the SDXL Prompt Styler gained toggles to disable styling for positive, negative, or both sentiments (bypass mode).
What updates were made to the SDXL Prompt Styler Advanced in the August 27, 2023 commit?

On August 27, 2023, the SDXL Prompt Styler Advanced received a new node for elaborate workflows with linguistic and supportive terms. Additionally, a selector to change the split behavior of the negative prompt was added, with special thanks to @WinstonWoof and @Danamir for their contributions.
What changes were made to the file structure and naming convention for style JSONs in the August 11, 2023 commit?

As of August 11, 2023, the file structure and naming convention for style JSONs have been updated. The system can now load styles from multiple JSON files, and style names are detected for duplicates, with a suffix added to ensure uniqueness.
What are the inputs and outputs of the SDXL Prompt Styler node?

The inputs for the SDXL Prompt Styler node are `text_positive`, `text_negative`, and `log_prompt`. The outputs are `text_positive` with a combined prompt and style for positive prompt, and `text_negative` with a combined prompt and style for negative prompt.
How can I install and use the SDXL Prompt Styler nodes?

To install and use the SDXL Prompt Styler nodes, open a terminal or command line interface, navigate to the `ComfyUI/custom_nodes/` directory, then run `git clone https://github.com/twri/sdxl_prompt_styler.git`. Finally, restart ComfyUI.
